captions.text:
<i>Thanks, I've been
out here all day.</i>

<i>Shall not
shall not be in vain</i>

Excuse me.
I was waiting for that space.

Yeah? Tough! Face it, lady,
we're younger and faster.

Help, someone! What are
you doing? Are you crazy?

Face it, girls. I'm older,
and I have more insurance.

title: Fried Green Tomatoes (7/10) Movie CLIP - Parking Lot Rage (1991) HD

comments.text: The Winn Dixie parking lot is the DEVIL.﻿
comments.author: Wilson Martin

comments.text:
Some punk did the exact thing to my mother today. I was riding and it was 
just as blatant. I walk past and told him nice parking spot. He says.Yeah 
it is. I appreciate it. then stares me down for a few seconds and says,I 
didn't think so.

Let me tell ya,had I been 25 again and not 50 and semi disabled I would 
have pounded this 30 something,flip flop wearing with socks,pony tail and 
130 pds soaking wet ass wipe into the pavement. Karma can be slooooooooow 
but this guy will run across the wrong, I mean right person one day and 
have his ass beat.﻿

comments.author: Brett Cannon

comments.text:
by the way, are people bad-mouthing me because i'm berating bates' 
character for what she did? and if so, is it because people here think that 
those two women got what they deserved? if THAT why I've been getting 
unpleasant replies from people here? I know those women might've been wrong 
for speeding right into the spot that she was going to take, but I still 
think bates' character went too far with her vandalizing their vehicle.﻿
comments.author: steve “steveman27” Kos

comments.text:

comments.author: Ricky Coogin

comments.text:
what she did was wrong and uncalled for. if there was no hope for her 
getting a parking spot there, then she should've driven to the nearest 
place where she could park, and walk from there. so what if it was just a 
movie? it was still bad for her to vandalize someone's vehicle just because 
there were no parking spaces left. if you say it's ok because it was just a 
movie, then why in movies, do the villains usually lose and the heroes 
usually win? maybe it's because it's what people want to see, even if they 
know it's a movie.﻿

comments.text:
i know that some individuals might like this scene, but i don't. i find it 
rather disturbing since she was still wrong for smashing someone's car. 
sure, maybe it would've been better if those women were more considerate 
towards her than they were, but still, that was no excuse for her slamming 
her car into theirs. also, another reason i don't like this scene is 
because it gives the implication that there wasn't a big enough parking lot 
and not enough parking space in general in the area.﻿
comments.author: steve “steveman27” Kos

comments.text:
Don't care if you believe you need to criticize this scene. It's a fantasy 
of many of us who deal with idiots in the parking lot, but it's not 
something we would actually do. Are you one of those people who do what 
those women in the beetle do, and you are afraid some middle age woman 
whose had it up to here...will do this to you? It's a movie. And a fine one 
at that. Get over it.
comments.author: KF Mosca

comments.text:
Steve Kosman  give it up.. let the movie go. Don't even watch it.. You are 
upset about a scene that was written for a movie.  Be upset about something 
real.. hungry children, animals that need a home .. things that are 
important in life.. Not a scene from a movie.
comments.author: linda stew

comments.text:
+Ammar Napata I know what you mean. the people who drove the red van had 
nothing to do with that parking lot incident, but as the car she was 
smashing into, it was a crappy, little car anyway, so it wasn't a huge loss 
for those women. if you had a cadillac brougham and you kept smacking it 
into a dodge neon, the neon would get totaled and your car would be 
virtually unscathed.

by a train.

with what I said about it.

comments.text:
So me and my mom were at Costco and my mom was waiting for this old man to 
get out of his parking space, and when he left this other car tried to get 
in the space first but luckily my mom is a badass and stepped on the pedal 
and got to the spot first. So I looked at her and said "mom what would you 
do if that guy got to the space first?" Then she looked and me and screamed 
"TOWANDAAAAAA"

comments.text:
I actually told a clerk at the grocery store about this scene. He saw that 
I bought some tomatoes, and asked if I was going to grill them. I told him 
that my Grandparents used to have fried green tomatoes every so often, and 
that I can't hear "Fried Green Tomatoes" without thinking of this movie and 
this particular scene. Kathy Bates is great here! I need to check out some 
of her other films.
comments.author: booboobabies

comments.text:
Thank you! Yeah I'm rather young, just turned 23 :P But I know what you 
mean. Most movies today (along with TV and most anything else that's 
"mainstream") just really lack quality and originality. It's all 
explosions, fights, fast cars, sex and drugs. That's pretty much it. I like 
the movies that actually have stories to them. And I love movies that make 
you think about certain issues in the world and whatnot. Just seems like 
everything is so bland and stupid compared to things in the past :/
